txt.en:
'Hermáth -- this harthrót is, without a doubt, the worst thing I've ever had the displeasure to cook. It is tough and refuses to soften no matter what I try. Small wonder that nobody has used it before!

'But we aren't in a position to choose. Even if I must cook it for hours on end, I will not let this plant defeat me!

'Still, there must be more we can add to this dish. I have some dried meat stored in... erm... well, it's in one of the rations crates around the camp. Could you help me find some?'
This crate does not have dried meat
Halvar is waiting by one of the camp-fires in Ashmargathâl.\n\nYou should bring the beer to him.
Talk to Halvar
Halvar has asked you to retrieve some dried meat from a rations crate, but he's not sure which one.\n\nThe crates can be found around Ashmargathâl.
Talk to Halvar
You should deliver the dried meats to Halvar, who's waiting by one of the camp-fires in Ashmargathâl.
DNT - Talk to Lúka
Unsatisfied with his progress, Halvar has decided to scrounge around for more ingredients.
DNT - Retrieve dried meat from rations crate
Found dried meat
DNT - Halvar has given you some food for Lúka.\n\nLúka can be found at TBD.

'Pairing this meat with the harthrót might just work, but... argh, there's just something missing, something... oh, I don't know, let's just throw some beer in! See what happens!\n\n'I don't have beer on hand, but Dági does. He should be nearby; ask him if we could take some.'
Ask Dági for beer
'Well... normally I'd rather save my alcohol for special occasions, but if Halvar is trying to make our food taste good, then count me in! Here you go -- best of luck!'
Beer obtained
Search rations crates for dried meat
DNT - 'This is for me? Ah... as always Halvar is right, I haven't had a chance to eat yet today. Thank you both. I'll be sure to enjoy it.'
Dági can be found somewhere in Ashmargathâl.\n\nTo complete the dish, Halvar would like for you to ask Dági for some beer.

'All right then, shoo! I have work to do.'

Halvar begins to cobble together the ingredients you gave him. After a while, he calls you over.

'Hermáth, this... this isn't bad. I'll have to keep working on it. It's nowhere near the level of food I could make back home, but it's a start. Here, have a taste!

'See? We've created something good, my friend.'
Odds and Ends
